alert.note: Alert for Cabell; Putnam; Wayne (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 17 at 6:40PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Cabell, southwestern Putnam, northern Lincoln and northeastern Wayne Counties through 715 PM EDT... At 640 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Beech Fork State Park, moving northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Wayne, Hamlin, Beech Fork State Park, Hurricane, Milton, Culloden, East Lynn Lake, Teays Valley, West Hamlin, Sweetland, Sod, Branchland, Salt Rock, Griffithsville, East Lynn, Yawkey and Myra. This includes Interstate 64 in West Virginia between mile markers 24 and 35. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
